description: Data structure for the 'project' table inside `pyproject.toml` according to PEP 621

name.description: The name (primary identifier) of the project. MUST be statically defined.

version.description: The version of the project as supported by PEP 440.

description.description: The summary description of the project.

OneOf.description: Relative path to a text file (UTF-8) containing the full description of the project.
OneOf.$comment: If the file path ends in case-insensitive `.md` or `.rst` suffixes, then the content-type is respectively `text/markdown` or `text/x-rst`

file.description: Relative path to a text file containing the full description of the project.

content-type.description: Content-type (RFC 1341) of the full description (e.g. `text/markdown`). The `charset` parameter is assumed UTF-8 when not present.

requires-python.description: The Python version requirements of the project.

file.description: Relative path to the file (UTF-8) which contains the license for the project.

text.description: The license of the project whose meaning is that of the License field from the core metadata

authors.description: The people or organizations considered to be the 'authors' of the project. The exact meaning is open to interpretation.

maintainers.description: The people or organizations considered to be the 'maintainers' of the project. The exact meaning is open to interpretation.

keywords.description: List of keywords to assist searching for the distribution in a larger catalog

classifiers.description: Trove classifiers which apply to the project.

urls.description: URLs associated with the project in the form `label => value`.

scripts.description: Instruct the installer to create command-line wrappers for the given entry points.

gui-scripts.description: Instruct the installer to create GUI wrappers for the given entry points. The difference between `scripts` and `gui-scripts` is only relevant in Windows.

entry-points.description: Instruct the installer to expose the given modules/functions via `entry-point` discovery mechanism (useful for plugins).

^([A-Z0-9]|[A-Z0-9][A-Z0-9._-]*[A-Z0-9]).$comment: The regex is taken from PEP 508 definition of identifier/name

dynamic.description: Specifies which fields are intentionally unspecified and expected to be dynamically provided by build tools

OneOf.$comment: Core metadata specifies only `name` and `version` as mandatory, but `name` MUST be static in PEP 621.

name.description: MUST be a valid email name (i.e. whatever can be put as a name, before an email, in RFC #822)

email.description: MUST be a valid email address

entry-point-group.$comment: Keys should be the entry-point name (recommended `[\w.-]+` - https://packaging.python.org/specifications/entry-points/ - TODO: should we make it mandatory?)

^[^\\[\\s=]([^=]*[^\\s=])?$.description: Pointer to a Python object. It is either in the form `importable.module`, or `importable.module:object.attr`.

dependency.description: Project dependency specification according to PEP 508
